EEB C177/C234: Practical Computing for Evolutionary Biologists and Ecologists (Winter 2020)

Instructor: Michael E. Alfaro, Ph.D.

TA: Shawn T. Schwartz

Enrollment: 15 Undergraduates, 2 Graduates

Lecture: T/Th 9:30-10:45am

Section: Lab 1A (8-10:50am), Lab 1B (11-1:50am)

Location: LaKretz Hall 120 (Lecture), Mathematical Sciences 5233 (Lab 1A), Young Hall 1044 (Lab 1B)

Course Description: Lecture, three hours; laboratory, two hours. Requisite: Life Sciences 1 or 7B. Introduction to fundamental skills needed for manipulation, analysis, and visualization of large data sets. Basic programming and scripting in Python as well as working in shell, regular expressions, and related topics.

Course Website: (https://eeb-c177-w20.github.io))
